instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Video No Ram Beep
threads.message: Hey guys had this one for a while, has cpu vcore mouse lights up but there is no chime or display, ram removed there is no ram beep <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_R</SIGNAL> is 0v replaced a bunch of components tried bios tried clock chip tried <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> even a smc still no luck. Is this a dead cpu. Or i am missing something here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Video No Ram Beep
threads.message: Could be anything and you tried to obvious stuff. Does it respond to PRAM reset with external/internal keyboard?
